intro: Pedicularis sceptrum-carolinum var. uniflora, commonly known as the western yellow crowfoot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its unique floral structure and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in both botanical and traditional herbal studies.
